title: A Baby's day at twelve weeks
creator_contributor_role: Yale Clinic of Child Development, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Child development
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Infants - Care and hygiene

description: The infant is followed through its domestic day from the time of its waking at six o'clock in the morning until the final breast feeding at ten o'clock at night. Presents dressing, bathing, feeding, daytime naps, play, and general care of the infant including an interpretation of the significance of various reactions. Narrated by Arnold Gesell.
